#WelcomeMessage:
Welcome to Nortantis. To create or open a map,
use the {0} menu.
#MapDrawError:
Map failed to draw due to an error.
To retry, use {0} -> {1}.
#HighlightLakesTooltip: Highlight lakes to make them easier to see.
#HighlightRiversTooltip: Highlight rivers to make them easier to see.
#UpdateAvailableMessage: Version {0} is now available. You can download it at
#OldPropertiesFileConverted: {0} is an older format '.properties' file. When you save, it will be converted to the newer format, a '{1}' file.
#KeyboardShortcutsMessage:
Keyboard shortcuts for navigating the map:
  • Zoom: Mouse wheel
  • Pan: Hold mouse middle button or CTRL and mouse left click, then drag

Each editor tool has a keyboard shortcut for switching to it. Hover over the tool's icon to see the shortcut.
#ErrorSettingLookAndFeel: Error while setting look and feel: {0}
#FolderCreationError: An error occurred while creating the folder: {0}
#InvalidArtPackEmpty: Invalid art pack. It's empty. It should have exactly one top-level folder, the name of which is the name of the art pack.
#InvalidArtPackMultipleFolders: Invalid art pack. It should have exactly one top-level folder, the name of which will be the name of the art pack. It has {0} top-level folders.
#InvalidArtPackName: The art pack name '{0}' is not allowed.
#OverwriteArtPackMessage: The art pack '{0}' already exists. Do you wish to overwrite it?
#MapDoesNotExist: The map '{0}' cannot be opened because it does not exist.
#CustomImagesFolderConvertedMessage: Your custom images folder has been automatically converted to the new structure.
#ErrorRestructuringCustomImages: Error while restructuring custom images folder for {0}: {1}
#SettingsModifiedSavePrompt: Settings have been modified. Save changes?
#BugReportPrompt: <html>If you have encountered a bug and wish to report it, you may do so at the Nortantis project's GitHub issue tracker here:</html>
#SupportPrompt: <html>If you have enjoyed Nortantis and wish to support it, and you like clean, happy, fantasy romance novels, then please consider purchasing one of my books listed at:</html>
#BeginsWithTooltip: Constrains generated names to start with the given letters.
#EndsWithTooltip: Constraints generated names to end with these letters.
#BooksForGeneratingNamesTooltip: Selected books will be used to generate names.
#NameGenErrorSuffix: Error: Unable to generate enough names with the given books and requested suffix. Try either adding more books or removing or reducing the suffix.
#NameGenErrorPrefix: Error: Unable to generate enough names with the given books and required prefix. Try including more books or removing or reducing the prefix.
#NameGenErrorGeneral: Error: Unable to generate enough names. Try including more books.
#NameGenConstraintError: Unable to generate enough names with the given constraints. Try using more books or reducing the suffix.
#ZoomTooltip: Zoom the map in or out (mouse wheel). To view more details at higher zoom levels, adjust the 'Display quality'.
#DisplayQualityTooltip: Change the quality of the map displayed in the editor. Does not apply when exporting the map to an image. Higher values make the editor slower.
#EnableOverlayImageTooltip: Show or hide the selected overlay image, if any.
#FitToMapTooltip: Resize and position the overlay image to fit the entire map, including borders.
#FitInsideBorderTooltip: Resize and position the overlay image to fit the drawable space on the map (the ocean/land), not including the border.
#BackgroundTooltip: Select how to generate the background image.
#TextureSourceTooltip: Select where to get the texture seed image from.
#TextureTooltip: Select a texture image as a seed from installed images that came with Nortantis, or from art packs or a custom images folder.
#TextureImageTooltip: Texture image that will be used to randomly generate a background.
#RandomSeedTooltip: The random seed used to generate the background image. Note that the background texture will also change based on the resolution you draw at.
#DrawPoliticalRegionBoundariesTooltip: Whether to show political region boundaries
#RotateLeftTooltip: Rotate the land shape counterclockwise by 90°.
#RotateRightTooltip: Rotate the land shape clockwise by 90°.
#RegionBoundaryColorTooltip: The line color of region boundaries
#ColorLandTooltip: Whether to change the land texture to a custom color versus use the color of the texture image
#LandColorTooltip: The color of the land background.
#ColorOceanTooltip: Whether to change the ocean texture to a custom color versus use the color of the texture image
#CreateBorderTooltip: When checked, a border will be drawn around the map.
#DrawGrungeTooltip: Whether to draw grunge around the edges of the map.
#BoldBackgroundForRegionAndTitleNames: Bold background for region and title names
#LakesTooltip: Lakes are the same as ocean except ocean effects (waves or shading) along their shores can be disabled, and they don't do coastline smoothing when enabled.
#RiverWidthTooltip: River width to draw. Note that different widths might look the same depending on the resolution the map is drawn at.
#SelectColorFromMapTooltip: To select the color of an existing region, click this button, then click that region on the map.
#GenerateColorTooltip: Generate a new color based on the random generation settings below.
#OnlyUpdateExistingLandTooltip: Causes the paint region brush to not create new land in the ocean.
#BaseColorTooltip: The base color for generating new region colors. This is the map's land color when not coloring regions.
#HueRangeTooltip: The possible range of hue values for generated region colors. The range is centered at the base color hue.
#SaturationRangeTooltip: The possible range of saturation values for generated region colors. The range is centered at the land color saturation.
#BrightnessRangeTooltip: The possible range of brightness values for generated region colors. The range is centered at the land color brightness.
#ArtPackTooltip: The set of images and icons to use. '{0}' is the images that come installed with Nortantis. '{1}' means use the custom images folder, if one is selected.
#AddTextTooltip: Add new text of the selected text type (Alt+A)
#ArtPackHasNoImagesForIconUsingFirstAvai: The art pack ''{0}'' no longer has {1} images, so it does not have the icon ''{2}'' from {1} image group ''{3}''. The art pack ''{4}'' will be used instead because it has {1} images.
#ArtPackHasNoImagesForIconUsingOther: The art pack ''{0}'' no longer has {1} images, so it does not have the icon ''{2}'' from {1} image group ''{3}''. The art pack ''{4}'' will be used instead because it has the same image group folder and image name.
#ArtPackHasNoImagesUsingFirstAvailable: The art pack ''{0}'' no longer has {1} images, so it does not have the {1} image group ''{2}''. The art pack ''{3}'' will be used instead because it has {1} images.{4}
#ArtPackHasNoImagesUsingOther: The art pack ''{0}'' no longer has {1} images, so it does not have the {1} image group ''{2}''. The art pack ''{3}'' will be used instead because it has the same image group folder name.{4}
#ArtPackNotFoundForGroupUsingOther: Unable to find the art pack ''{0}'' to load the {1} image group ''{2}''. The art pack ''{3}'' will be used instead because it has the same image group folder name.{4}
#ArtPackNotFoundForIconUsingOther: Unable to find the art pack ''{0}'' to load the icon ''{1}'' from {2} image group ''{3}''. The art pack ''{4}'' will be used instead because it has the same image group folder and image name.
#ArtPackNotFoundForIconUsingRandom: Unable to find the art pack ''{0}'' to load the icon ''{1}'' from {2} image group ''{3}''. The art pack ''{4}'' will be used instead.
#ArtPackNotFoundUsingRandom: Unable to find the art pack ''{0}'' to load the {1} image group ''{2}''. The art pack ''{3}'' will be used instead.{4}
#AtLeastOneBook: At least one book must be selected to generate text.
#BorderTypeFolderMissing: The selected border type ''{0}'' does not have a folder for images in {1}.
#CustomBackgroundsNotSupported: Creating maps from custom land and ocean background images is no longer supported.
#DictionaryReadError: Unable to read word dictionary file.
#DormantTreesMessage: These trees are not visible because they were drawn at low density, but may become visible if you change the tree height in the Effects tab.
#FileContainingNotFound: Unable to find a file containing "{0}" in the directory {1}
#FontParseError: Unable to parse the value of the font: "{0}"
#IconNotFoundUsingOther: Unable to find the {0} icon ''{1}'' in art pack ''{2}''. The icon ''{3}'' in art pack ''{4}'' will be used instead.
#ImageGroupNotFoundNoIcons: Unable to find the {0} image group ''{1}'' in art pack ''{2}''. There are no {0} icons, so none will be drawn.
#ImageGroupNotFoundNoIconsInArtPack: Unable to find the {0} image group ''{1}'' in art pack ''{2}''. There are no {0} icons in that art pack, so none will be drawn.
#ImageGroupNotFoundUsingOther: Unable to find the {0} image group ''{1}'' in art pack ''{2}''. The group ''{3}'' in art pack ''{4}'' will be used instead.
#ImageGroupNotFoundUsingOtherInArtPack: Unable to find the {0} image group ''{1}'' in art pack ''{2}''. The group ''{3}'' in that art pack will be used instead.{4}
#ImageHasHeightAndWidth: The image {0} has both an encoded height and width. Only one is allowed.
#ImageSizeZero: The image ''{0}'' has an encoded width or height of 0.
#MapFromNewerVersion: The map cannot be loaded because it was made in a new version of Nortantis. That map''s version is {0}, but you''re Nortantis version is {1}. Try again with a newer version of Nortantis.
#MismatchedEdgeCount: The map edits have {0} edges, but graph has {1} edges.
#MismatchedPolygonCount: The map edits have {0} polygons, but the world size is {1}
#MultipleFilesContainingFound: More than one file contains "{0}" in the directory {1}
#MultipleImagesSameName: There are multiple images for {0} named ''{1}'' whose file names only differ by their encoded width or height or extension. Rename one of them.
#NoCornerImagesFound: Border cannot be drawn. Could not find any corner images in {0}
#NoEdgeImagesFound: Border cannot be drawn. Couldn't find any edge images in {0}
#NoTextureFileSelected: The selected background texture source is ''{0}'', but no texture image file is selected. An image from assets was used instead.
#NotEnoughNames: The selected books do not have enough names to generate new names. Try selecting more books.
#OceanBackgroundAspectRatioMismatch: The given ocean background image does not have the same aspect ratio as the given land background image.
#OverlayImageIsFolder: The overlay image ''{0}'' is a folder. It should be a JPG or PNG image file.
#OverlayImageNotExist: The overlay image ''{0}'' does not exist.
#PropertyMissingOrUnreadable: Property "{0}" is missing or cannot be read.
#UnableToDrawBorderArtPackMissing: Unable to draw the border because the selected border type, ''{0}'', is from the art pack ''{1}'', which does not exist.
#UnableToReadTexture: Unable to read the texture image file name "{0}"
#UnsupportedSettingsFile: The map settings file, ''{0}'', is not a supported file type. It must be either either a json file or a properties file.
#BoldBackgroundColorTooltip: If ''{0}'' is checked, title and region names will be given a bold background in this color.
#BoldBackgroundCheckboxLabel: Bold background for region and title names
#BoldBackgroundCheckboxTooltip: Whether to draw bolded letters behind region and title text to highlight them.
#BorderColorTooltip: Transparent pixels in the border will show the background texture drawn with this color.
#BorderTypeTooltip: The set of images to draw for the border
#BorderWidthTooltip: Width of the border in pixels, scaled according to the resolution the map is drawn at.
#ChangeTextColorTooltip: Change the color of this text
#CityFrequencyTooltip: Higher values create more cities. Lower values create less cities. Zero means no cities.
#CityIconTypeTooltip: The set of city images to use.
#CitySizeTooltip: Changes the size of all cities on the map
#CoastShadingColorTooltip: Land near coastlines and political region boundaries will be shaded this color.
#CoastShadingDisabledMessage: <html>Disabled because the land coloring method is ''{0}''.<html>
#CoastShadingTransparencyTooltip: Transparency of shading of land near coastlines
#CoastShadingWidthTooltip: How far in from coastlines to shade land. Also applies to region boundaries if regions are drawn.
#CustomImagesFolderAngleBracketsInfo: <html>The names above in angle brackets are folder and file names that you can configure to be whatever name you want. Folder names without angle brackets, however, must be exactly as described above or else Nortantis will ignore those folders. Images must be either PNG or JPG format. PNG is recommended because it supports transparency and isn''t lossy.</html>
#CustomImagesFolderBorderInfo: <html>Valid border image names are 'upper_left_corner', 'upper_right_corner', 'lower_left_corner', 'lower_right_corner', 'top_edge', 'bottom_edge', 'left_edge', 'right_edge'. At least one corner and one edge must be given. If corners are wider than the sides of edges, the corners will be inset into the map.</html>
#CustomImagesFolderHillInfo: <html>If you want new maps to add hills around mountains, then for each mountain type, create a hill type with the same name.</html>
#CustomImagesFolderIconSizingInfo: For icons (things drawn in the Icons tool), to control the size your images draw on your map, you can specify a width or height in the file name, such as width= (or w for short) or height= (or h for short). For example, an image named "large castle w28.png" will draw at 28 units wide (where a unit is a measurement based on the width of polygons in the map). Only width or height can be given, not both; that way scaling respects the aspect ratio. If you specify the size of just one image in a folder, then the others will be scaled proportionately to that one. Note that mountain and hill sizes vary based on the size of the polygons they are initially drawn on. Also, any icon can be resized on the map by editing it using the Icons tool, and the Effects tab has slider bars to resize all icons of a type.
#CustomImagesFolderInfo: <html>A custom images folder allows you to use your own images to create an art pack named ''{0}'' that is specific to this map. To do so, enter a path to a folder with your images, or select and folder and Nortantis will copy its installed images into it as a starting point. The required folder structure is given below. Note that this is the same folder structured used by art packs.</html>
#CustomImagesFolderRefreshInfo: <html>After making changes to custom images, to get Nortantis to see those changes you can either close and re-open Nortantis or use {0} -> {1}.</html>
#CustomImagesFolderRevertInfo: <html>To revert back to using installed images/art packs, clear out the field below.</html>
#CustomImagesFolderTooltip: Configure custom images to use when generating this map.
#DimensionsTooltip: Dimensions of the map when exported at 100% resolution, although the resolution can be scaled up or down while exporting. This doesn't include the border, if you add one.
#DuneSizeTooltip: Changes the size of all sand dunes on the map
#EnableTextTooltip: Enable/disable drawing text. When unselected, text will still exist, but will not be shown.
#ErrorCheckingIfEmpty: Error while checking if {0} is empty: {1}
#ErrorCopyingInstalledImages: Error while copying installed images into {0}: {1}
#ErrorCreatingPreviewImages: Error while creating preview images for buttons: {0}
#ExecutionExceptionNoCause: An ExecutionException error occurred with no cause:
#ExportActionTooltip: Whether to save the map to a file or open it in your system's default image viewer.
#ExportFileIsDir: There is a directory with the same name as the export file, in the same folder.
#ExportFileMustBeImage: The export file must be a png or jpeg image.
#ExportFolderNotExist: The export file folder does not exist.
#ExportPathInvalid: The export file path is invalid.
#ExportedOpeningInViewer: Opening the {0} in your system''s default image editor.
#FrayEdgesTooltip: Whether to fray the edges of the map.
#FrayShadingWidthTooltip: The width of shading drawn around frayed edges. The color used is the grunge color.
#FraySizeTooltip: Determines the number of polygons used when creating the frayed border. Higher values make the fray larger.
#FrayedEdgesSeedTooltip: The random seed used to generate the frayed edges.
#GrungeColorTooltip: Grunge and frayed edge shading will be this color
#GrungeWidthTooltip: Determines the width of grunge on the edges of the map. 0 means none.
#HillSizeTooltip: Changes the size of all hills on the map
#ImageTooltip: Image to draw over the map (not including borders). This is useful when drawing a map from a reference image.
#LineStyleTooltip: The style of lines to use when drawing coastlines, lake shores, and region boundaries
#MakeDefaultForNewMaps: Make this the default for new maps
#MountainSizeTooltip: Changes the size of all mountains on the map
#NoDimensionOption: No dropdown menu option with dimensions {0} x {1}
#NoIconForButton: No ''{0}'' icon exists for the button ''{1}''
#OceanShadingColorTooltip: Ocean near coastlines will be shaded this color.
#OceanShadingWidthTooltip: How far from coastlines to shade ocean.
#OutOfMemoryDisplay: Out of memory. Try decreasing the Display Quality.
#OutOfMemoryExport: Out of memory. Try exporting at a lower resolution, or decreasing the Display Quality before exporting.
#ReplaceTooltip: Use the selected brush to replace existing icons of the same type
#RotateToHorizontalTooltip: Set the rotation angle of the selected text to 0 degrees.
#StyleOptionsTooltip: Options for how to draw concentric waves.
#StyleTooltipRegion: Line style for drawing region boundaries
#TreeHeightTooltip: Changes the height of all trees on the map, and redistributes trees to preserve forest density
#TypeTooltip: The type of icon to add/edit.
#UseDefaultColorTooltip: When checked, this text uses the text color in the Fonts tab.
#WaveColorTooltip: The color of the ocean waves.
#WaveCountTooltip: The number of concentric waves to draw.
#WaveTypeTooltip: Which type of wave to draw in the ocean along coastlines.
#WaveWidthTooltip: How far from coastlines waves should draw.
#ChangeBoldBackgroundColorTooltip: Change the color of the bold background of this text
#BooksForGeneratingTextTooltip: Selected books will be used to generate new names.
#TransparencyTooltip: Transparency to add to the overlay image to help with seeing the map underneath it.
#WorldSizeLabel:
World size:
(cannot be changed in editor)
#WorldSizeTooltip: The number of polygons in the randomly generated world.
#EdgeLandProbTooltip: The probability that a tectonic plate touching the edge of the map will be land rather than ocean.
#CenterLandProbTooltip: The probability that a tectonic plate not touching the edge of the map will be land rather than ocean.
#OceanEffectTooltip: Choose a color for waves near coastlines.
#RiverColorTooltip: Rivers will be drawn this color.
